entries.name: ARP Redshift Law (derived mapping)
entries.description: A redshift-like relaxation emerges when an ARP-governed transport variable is mapped to a normalized deficit observable.
entries.derivation: Assume post-event ARP relaxation: G(t)=G_{\infty}+(G(0)-G_{\infty})e^{-\mu t}. Define z(t):=z_0\left(1-\frac{G(t)-G_{\infty}}{G(0)-G_{\infty}}\right) \Rightarrow z(t)=z_0(1-e^{-\mu t}), so \gamma\equiv\mu.
assumptions: Single-timescale exponential relaxation dominates over the interval (constant \mu).
z(t) is defined as a monotone normalized deficit of a relaxing transport/coherence variable.
A stable asymptote G_{\infty} (equivalently z_0) exists over the measurement window.

entries.name: ARP Lyapunov Stability Form
entries.description: Candidate stability proof template for adaptive conductance dynamics.
entries.equationLatex: V(x)\ge 0,\ V(0)=0;\ \dot V(x)=\nabla V\cdot \dot x\le -\alpha V(x)

entries.name: Temperature-Dependent Conductance Law
entries.description: Extends ARP equilibrium with an exponential temperature factor for material sensitivity.

entries.name: Shielding Mechanism Law (ARP)
entries.description: Proposes a shielding effect in ARP systems, modeled as a fractional reduction of the external field. The effective field is E_eff = (1 ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Â¹ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¾Ã‚Â¢ ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â»)E_ext, while the induced adaptive current follows J_adapt = ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚ÂÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Â ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢E_ext, with 0 < ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â» < 1.

entries.name: Redshift-ARP Superconductivity Law
entries.description: Proposes a cosmological scaling for critical superconducting resistance: R_s(z) = R_{s,0} (1+z)^alpha. Assumes layered structure, universal conductance constant, ARP regime dominant.

entries.name: Phase-Lifted Complex Conductance Update
entries.description: Complex-admittance lift of ARP: conductance grows along the instantaneous current phasor direction using a Phase-Lifted (unwrapped) phase. Assumes phase-coherent transport where a complex ~G is meaningful. Optional variant: include a Z2 parity factor b_ij = (-1)^{w_ij} multiplying e^{iÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¸_R,ij} to model sign flips under branch crossings.

Predicts a sharp stability/transition-like behavior when ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¸_R approaches half-integer multiples of ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚ÂÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…Â¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¬ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â¬Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â¡ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â (maximal sinÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…Â¡ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â²). Assumptions: ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¸_R,ij is a Phase-Lifted (unwrapped) phase-like observable for edge current; ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚ÂÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…Â¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¬ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â¬Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â¡ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â sets the relevant phase period; ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â» has units 1/time.

entries.name: ARP Redshift Law (two-timescale extension)
entries.description: Two-timescale ARP redshift relaxation captures fast+slow approach to asymptote and supports AIC/BIC model selection against the single-timescale baseline.
entries.differentialLatex: \dot z = z_0\left(a\gamma_1 e^{-\gamma_1 t} + (1-a)\gamma_2 e^{-\gamma_2 t}\right)
entries.derivation: Start from a convex combination of two exponential relaxations toward z_0: z(t)=z_0(1-ae^{-\gamma_1 t}-(1-a)e^{-\gamma_2 t}), 0<=a<=1. This nests the single-timescale law when \gamma_1=\gamma_2 or a in {0,1}.
assumptions: Two separated relaxation channels with rates gamma_1 and gamma_2.
Mixing weight a is bounded: 0<=a<=1.
z_0 is a stable asymptote over the fit interval.
Model comparison uses AIC/BIC on the same data window.

entries.name: PL-AIN Geometry-Weighted Magnitude Update
entries.description: ARP reinforcement/decay scaled by local adaptive phase-period field Omega_ij=pi_a/pi, yielding geometry-aware learning strength.
entries.derivation: Start from ARP edge update dG/dt=alpha|I|-mu G and modulate reinforcement by local phase-period scale Omega_ij=pi_a/pi.
assumptions: Edge-local adaptive phase scale pi_a(ij,t)>0 is measurable or estimable.
Reinforcement remains linear in |I_ij| to first order.
Decay term mu_G G_ij dominates when excitation weakens.

entries.name: PL-AIN Phase-Friction Update Law
entries.description: History-resolved phase evolves by unwrap-rate minus regularizer gradient, creating explicit dynamical phase-sheet selection.
entries.derivation: Lift principal argument to unwrapped phase theta^R and introduce a phase-regularizer potential Phi with damping strength eta.
assumptions: unwrap_rate is well-defined under sampling cadence.
Regularizer Phi is differentiable in theta^R.
eta>=0 controls phase smoothing without destroying observability.

entries.name: PL-AIN Network Parity Holonomy Invariant
entries.description: Defines a Z2 cycle label from edge windings; parity holonomy changes only at branch-crossing singularities (Y_ij=0) under the conjectured robustness condition.
entries.derivation: Given w_ij=Delta theta^R_ij/(2 pi_a) and b_ij=(-1)^{w_ij}, define global holonomy B(omega)=Product_{(i,j) in E} b_ij(omega)=(-1)^{Sum w_ij(omega)}.
assumptions: Drive protocol is cyclic with repeat boundary conditions.
Edge admittance trajectories are continuous in time.
Parity flips require branch-crossing events in complex admittance plane.
Formal boundary: singularity crossing manifold is Y_{ij}=0 in complex admittance plane; parity flips require crossing this manifold.

validation.summary: Across epsilon in [0,0.20], winding/parity stay locked (w=1,b=-1), lifted mode removes branch-cut slips (0 vs 1 per cycle), and visibility improves at equal noise model.

entries.formalFailureCriterionLatex: \text{Parity change is possible iff }\exists\,(i,j),t:\ |Y_{ij}(t,\omega)|=0.\ \text{If }\min_t|Y_{ij}(t,\omega)|>0\ \forall(i,j),\text{ parity is topologically locked under small deformations.}

entries.name: PL-AIN Phase-Geometry Weighted Budget Law
entries.description: Weighted conductance budget G_Omega biases competition by local phase geometry and is proposed as a stability-promoting control under renormalized updates.
entries.derivation: Define G_Omega(t)=Sum_{(i,j)} Omega_ij(t) G_ij(t) with Omega_ij=pi_a/pi and enforce G_Omega<=G_tot via renormalization.
assumptions: Renormalization step is applied each iteration.
Omega_ij is bounded and positive.
Sparse backbone emerges from weighted competition under budget cap.

entries.name: Phase-Lift Operator (AHC explicit branch)
entries.description: Makes branch choice explicit by evaluating f(z) on a history-resolved unwrapped phase trajectory.
entries.derivation: Define theta_R via unwrap(arg z; theta_ref), then evaluate f(z) on that lifted branch so branch choice is explicit rather than implicit.
assumptions: Reference phase is available at each update.
Sampling cadence is high enough to unwrap phase without aliasing.
No persistent z=0 singular crossings in the measured interval.
entries.equationLatex: (\,\u29c9 f\,)(z;\theta_{\rm ref}) := f(z)\ \text{computed using}\ \theta_R=\mathrm{unwrap}(\arg z;\theta_{\rm ref})

entries.name: PR-Root Deterministic Branch Form
entries.description: PR-Root writes the square root on an explicit resolved phase, eliminating silent plus/minus branch ambiguity.
entries.derivation: Write z=r e^{i theta}; replace theta by unwrapped theta_R and define root as sqrt(r)e^{i theta_R/2}.
assumptions: Magnitude r is nonnegative and measured robustly.
theta_R continuity is maintained by unwrap updates.

entries.name: Winding-Parity Z2 Shadow
entries.description: Encodes sheet return behavior with integer winding and its Z2 parity shadow for robust branch bookkeeping.
entries.derivation: Compute winding from lifted phase advance w=Delta theta_R/(2pi), then define parity/branch sign via w mod 2 and (-1)^w.
assumptions: Loop is closed or near-closed over each measurement cycle.
Lifted phase increment is computed on a consistent branch convention.

entries.name: AHC Step-Limited Unwrapper
entries.description: AHC updates lifted phase with a clip limit controlled by pi_a, suppressing one-shot branch jumps from noisy residuals.
entries.derivation: Compute candidate unwrap u_k and residual r_k=u_k-theta_{R,k-1}; update by adding clipped residual in [-pi_{a,k-1}, pi_{a,k-1}].
assumptions: Residuals are approximately local between adjacent runs.
pi_a is positive and updated online.
Sampling interval resolves Ramsey phase dynamics.

entries.name: AHC Adaptive pi_a Update
entries.description: Adaptive pi_a increases on event stimulus and relaxes toward baseline pi_0, setting local phase tolerance for AHC.
entries.derivation: Use event indicator S_k for out-of-budget residuals and apply reinforce/decay recursion around baseline pi_0.
assumptions: Stimulus S_k is bounded (e.g., binary trigger).
alpha_pi and mu_pi are chosen to avoid unstable overshoot.
Baseline pi_0 is fixed over the test interval.

entries.name: AHC Parity Flip-Rate Observable
entries.description: Defines a measurable parity switching rate used to detect AHC locking as alpha_pi/mu_pi increases.
entries.derivation: Track b_k=(-1)^{w_k} per cycle and compute empirical transition frequency across K samples.
assumptions: Cycles are comparable across runs.
Parity state b_k is estimated consistently from lifted winding.

entries.name: U(N) Holonomy Wilson Loop
entries.description: Extends Phase-Lift bookkeeping to matrix-valued transport with path-ordered U(N) holonomy.
entries.derivation: Define loop transport operator as path-ordered exponential of gauge connection integrated around cycle gamma.
assumptions: Connection A is regular along the closed path.
Control loop is sufficiently sampled for stable holonomy estimation.
Gauge/frame convention is fixed across comparisons.

entries.name: U(N) Lifted Det-Phase Winding and Parity
entries.description: Uses lifted determinant phase of U(N) holonomy to compute winding and Z2 parity in the same AHC branch-tracking framework.
entries.derivation: Lift arg det U with unwrap and adaptive period pi_a, then compute integer winding and parity sign from lifted phase advance.
assumptions: det U is nonzero along analyzed cycles.
Unwrap reference is propagated continuously cycle-to-cycle.
Adaptive phase period pi_a remains positive.
